name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
description:
Adversaries may manipulate application software prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise. Supply chain compromise of software can take place in a number of ways, including manipulation of the application source code, manipulation of the update/distribution mechanism for that software, or replacing compiled releases with a modified version.

Targeting may be specific to a desired victim set or may be distributed to a broad set of consumers but only move on to additional tactics on specific victims.(Citation: Avast CCleaner3 2018)(Citation: Command Five SK 2011)

external_references.description: Avast Threat Intelligence Team. (2018, March 8). New investigations into the CCleaner incident point to a possible third stage that had keylogger capacities. Retrieved March 15, 2018.
Command Five Pty Ltd. (2011, September). SK Hack by an Advanced Persistent Threat. Retrieved April 6, 2018.

x_mitre_detection: Use verification of distributed binaries through hash checking or other integrity checking mechanisms. Scan downloads for malicious signatures and attempt to test software and updates prior to deployment while taking note of potential suspicious activity.

mitigates.name: Update Software
mitigates.description: Perform regular software updates to mitigate exploitation risk.

mitigates.name: Vulnerability Scanning
mitigates.description: Vulnerability scanning is used to find potentially exploitable software vulnerabilities to remediate them.

requirements.description: Ensure that the patch management solution is configured to update the applications to the latest build
Ensure that monitoring tools are configured to monitor vulnerability sources to identify vulnerabilities
Ensure that code review tools (automatic and manual) are implemented to review codes for vulnerabilities
Ensure that the hash checking solution is implemented to verify distributed binaries
Ensure that the endpoint security solution is configured to scan all the downloaded files for malicious signatures
